Detailed Description

Internal interface base class for protocol layer abstractions.

Warning;
This is an internal interface and must not be used outside APOXI at all. However, developers of Transport Adapters for APOXI OBEX will need to understand the concepts explained in the following paragraph.

This interface encapsules an abstraction of the transport protocol layer to be used with OBEX and possible protocols building on OBEX. Transport connections are referred to by ObexChannel instances, which must be obtained from (AcquireClientChannel(), AcquireServerChannel()) and and returned to (ReleaseChannel()) a specific transport implementation. The Transport Adapter therefore acts as channel factory and is therefore able to set channel properties to reflect the behaviour of that specific transport.

See also:
ObexChannel
All public members which take a parameter of type ObexOperationId execute asynchronsly, their completion must be indicated by calling OnComplete() passing the ObexOperationId of the operation just completed.
See also:
ObexOperationId

ObexProtocol::ObexProtocol (  TypeId  type_id  )  [protected]
 

Constructor.

Derived concrete classes must assign a unique TypeId value which should be one of the values of the global enum type ObexProtocolId.

Member Function Documentation

virtual ObexResult ObexProtocol::AcquireClientChannel (  ObexChannel &  result,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
BOOLEAN  reserve
)  [pure virtual]
 

Abstract factory method for client transport channels.

Must be implemented to return a client channel object for the specified protocol. The Channel object must be unique among all channels of the same transport and protocol. However, the under- lying transport service may be shared with other channels.

Parameters:
result Reference to a channel object to hold the result. It will be overwritten in case of success.
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding a valid transport address, necessary to determine whether the channel is unique or not.
Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error otherwise (possibly lack of resources).

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual ObexResult ObexProtocol::AcquireServerChannel (  ObexChannel &  result,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
BOOLEAN  reserve
)  [pure virtual]
 

Abstract factory method for server transport channels.

Must be implemented to return a server channel object for the specified protocol. The Channel object must be unique among all channels of the same transport and protocol. However, the under- lying transport service may be shared with other channels.

Parameters:
result Reference to a channel object to hold the result. It will be overwritten in case of success.
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding a valid transport address, necessary to determine whether the channel is unique or not.
reserve If set to TRUE, indicates that private transport resources should be reserved for this channel. However, an implementation may choose to silently ignore this hint.
Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error otherwise (possibly lack of resources).

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual void ObexProtocol::BindServerChannel (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr
)  [pure virtual]
 

Binds a server transport channel to an OBEX address.

The channel must have been previously obtained by calling AcquireServerChannel(). After the operation has been completed, an implementation must call OnComplete() to return the result asynchronously.

See also:
OnComplete()
Parameters:
server_chan Server transport channel to open.
oper_id Operation identifier
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding the OBEX address of the service to connect to

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual void ObexProtocol::CloseChannel (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id
)  [pure virtual]
 

Closes a transport channel.

The channel must have been previously obtained by calling AcquireServerChannel() or AcquireClientChannel(). In case of a client channel, it must have been opened by invoking OpenClientChannel(). In case of a server channel, it must have been bound to a service by invoking BindServerChannel(). After the operation has been completed, an implementation must call OnComplete() to return the result asynchronously.

See also:
OnComplete()
Parameters:
channel Transport channel to close.
oper_id Operation identifier

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

void ObexProtocol::OnComplete (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
ObexResult  result
)  [protected]
 

Returns operation result.

This method is used by protocol implementations for specific transports which derive their implementationm from this base class. It should be called to indicate completion of a pending request.

Parameters:
channel Transport channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier associated with the request.
result Return code indicating either success or an error cause.

void ObexProtocol::OnTransportError (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
ObexResult  status
)  [protected]
 

Indicates disconnection of the transport layer.

In case of abnormal transport or protocol disconnection (IrDA device gets out of sight, USB plug pulled etc.) or other spontanous malfunctions detected by the protocol implementation this method must be invoked.

It must be called for each channel affected by the problem !

Parameters:
channel Affected transport channel.
oper_id Operation id of the operation pending for that channel, or an invalid operation id if not applicable !
status Error code further describing the problem.

virtual void ObexProtocol::OpenClientChannel (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr
)  [pure virtual]
 

Opens an OBEX client transport channel.

The channel must have been previously obtained by calling AcquireClientChannel(). After the operation has been completed, an implementation must call OnComplete() to return the result asynchronously.

See also:
OnComplete()
Parameters:
obex_chan Channel to open
oper_id Operation identifier
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding the OBEX address of the service to connect to

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual ObexResult ObexProtocol::ReleaseChannel (  ObexChannel &  channel  )  [pure virtual]
 

Releases an ObexChannel.

Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error otherwise.

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.
